title: Good design studios in San Francisco?
content:
I was wondering if any San Francisco locals could suggest some good graphic design studios in SF. 

I have done extensive research on the web, books and through the AIGA, put a list together, then thought it may be worth asking the San Francisco Typophiles as well.

My list so far includes SF standards like: Cahan, Chen, Character, Howry, Paper Plane, Tolleson, Stone Yamashita, Volume, UDN, Pentagram, Wolf Olins and Landor.

Any help would be much appreciated.

 [‹ Halloween!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406143835/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15955 "Go to previous forum topic") [FF Meta vs Lexus Opti ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406143835/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15628 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Jem

comments.content:
AKQA  
BBDO West  
DDB - SF  
FCB - SF  
Publicis  
Grey Flobal Group
What area of graphic design do you seek to work in? (excuse me for ending the sentence with a preposition... I’m tired.)
In which area of graphic design would you like to work? (better?)

Print, Identity design and application.  
(possibly book publishing)

Thanks David.

\> possibly book publishing

NY is the right place, but the best one in SF: Chronicle Books.
I’d look at [MINE](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406143835/http:/www.minesf.com/) if you’re interested in aligning yourself with a rising star in the disciplines you’ve mentioned.

I checked out MINE’s site, looked at the first item in their portfolio, ID for Brainfloss, liked their “cheaky” logo for it, but no link to the Brainfloss site. I went there nonetheless, and there’s no logo, just brainfloss.com in lower case Helvetica —- Aaaaargh!
At first glance Jared, I thought you meant “MINE” as in [“YOUR’S.”](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406143835/http:/www.punchcut.com/) :)
Me too, I thought, let’s see what Jared is up to...
Thanks Jared “Mine” is exactly to type of company I was looking for.
